author: cardano4climate
title: Cardano4Climate Community Hub
description: 现在是时候让Cardano对气候变化的影响变得可衡量了。一个全球的HUB需要连接当地的挑战和任务驱动的解决方案

f6_assessments.q0:
The very good created proposal, answering all three parts of the assessment.

Creating a global hub for joining local challenges and missions can definitely create a shared space for this area. 

It can then increase communication, share ideas, and therefore increase solving of climate tasks and missions.

Also, the proposal is highly aligned with the challenge goal.

Rating given 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
Based on the information in the proposal seems sufficient that it will be successfully implemented.

They claim a community of 150 people and 8 team members - who are described in larger detail. Seems appropriate and reasonable. 


Also, the budget is appropriate for its use.

Rating given 5.
f6_assessments.q2:
The suitability is divided into a roadmap that provides a timetable of subtasks completed and KPIs which are relevant and reasonable.

Based on the overall proposal, it is obvious that the team behind it knows what they are doing, what they aim to do, and how to do it.

Rating given 5.

f6_assessments.q0: I see this solution as really impactful on society and communities today because the scale that blockchain creates is undeniable. Not only proving its influence, but also building a large community to take actions that are suitable for the environment. In addition to the initial goals I also want us to have specific missions in the future and where we live. Not just communication energy, but the actions and events we can bring.
f6_assessments.q1: With the list of core team and individual roles, I think this proposal can build a strong community. With the roadmap in 3 months, we can easily access and build communication through social media channels. But show me your vision for the next year. I look forward to seeing the paths that build and regenerate nature. From such actions will be possible for global communication. With a capital of $ 6765, it will probably be reasonable in the first 3 months to call the community, but I rate Event Incentives & C4C Veritree contribution: $608 is not really enough to have quality events. For we must go and call, organize...
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding KPIs, I see that the team wants to focus on building small communities and then getting bigger through social media channels like discord, twitter but still quite general and not specific. It is not enough to focus mainly on education and appropriate languages. I want the KPI to be able to state in the time from 1 year to half a year how many events can we run around the world, how many people will listen, how many polluted places will be stable. Thank you very much

f6_assessments.q0:
Cardano4Climate is an existing young community hub that this proposal aims at growing, buy providing support to the core team and incubation funds for this community. During the past three months C4C has indeed hosted several events, townhalls and workshops. 
Success is defined by the growth of the core team and double in size the number of active members from 150 to 300. The proposal also targets the translation of C4C content into 2 to 3 other languages. 
This proposal meets the scale-up Cardano's community hub challenge criteria, and I agree that it will have an impact on Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
The core team is composed of 8 members skilled, enthusiast and engaged. A 3 month roadmap is provided, with a comprehensive list of objectives to be achieved each month. 
This proposal requests a reasonable budget. 2/3 of the budget is a remuneration for 3 team members during 3 months, without more precision on its allocation. I recommend the proposer to clarify how remuneration fundings will be used, and how it is connected to roadmap objectives. 
Some of the objectives are ambitious and requires significative engagement by the community  "1 self sustaining on-chain + off chain project has begun". It is not easy to understand how the team will get there. It depends on the ability to receive projects from the community, to select and fund them. For this part of the proposal, I consider that the feasibility is not guaranteed.
But as the main objective is to grow the community, I consider it is likely that the proposal will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2:
The detailed roadmap makes it easy for the community to monitor the progress. To increase the transparency, a public GitHub repository has been initiated to track ongoing tasks and actions.
And considering that the team holds weekly planning, I rate project auditability with a "5".
f6_assessments.reply: Even tho the assessments are very good and praise our effort, unfortunately there is no rationale as to why we don't get a 5 star rating or what we could do better on the Impact / Alignment.

f6_assessments.q0: Climate Change is a meaningful topic that many people care about. Therefore the combination of addressing Climate Change and Cardano will help scale-up the Cardano community in a good way: having newcomers that care about the world. This will promise these new people are trustworthy because they care and want to contribute to the community. Contributing to changing the world is also Cardano's core mission. So this project is a great initiative for this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: In the past 3 months, they have already started: grown a community around communication channels & a shared vision. The community is currently 150 members, this can ensure the number of people joining this Hub. Moreover, they demonstrate their plan very detail on the proposal with clear Road Map and vision. The activities listed also very detail and logical.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs and road map are on point, detail and enough information to measure the success of the project step by step. The team also committed to improving the transparency of our process & decisions with increased accessibility of the information to all of stakeholders by using GitHub. Ensuring transparency is a great way to help the project more auditable.
